what's the difference between the old style of formatting such as %5.2f and the new style {:5.2f}
if I'm understanding the question correctly...
the .format makes you list the variables at the end
and the f'{} allows you to type individual variables as you need them so you don't have to list them in order after you typed out the string
both do the job just fine though
it is a matter of preference

@killcams That sort of problem is almost always caused by installing the requirements to a different instance of Python than the one you're invoking to run the script
would it be because I have 2 different pythons installed
@Deleted User Look for some problems in your life that seem like they are interesting applications of Python as problem solving or automation tool
If one of them is tied to something important then it's unwise to just remove them
If you type `py` at the command line that will typically bring up the most recent version of Python
so you can use that to disambiguate which version you want to install in or use
eg. `py 3.8 m pip list` will bring up Python 3.8 and run `pip`

@killcams either way you can use `py` to bring up and work with a specific version
Use `py 0` to see which versions are installed
